resource.name: The Horseshoe Crab: A Keystone Species
resource.description: The Atlantic horseshoe crab (Limulus polyphemus) is a keystone species in the Delaware Bay region, supporting multiple ecosystems and industries important to human health and livelihood.

resource.name: Go Green, Save Green: Rebates, Grants, and Services
resource.description: DNREC provides grants for energy efficiency and clean fuel technology, supports energy policy development, and provides coordination and assistance to support sustainable land use and building practices.

resource.name: Cleaner Air Delaware: Air Quality Monitoring
resource.description: Recognizing public health, the environment, and the economy as key components in finding solutions to air pollution, DNREC has made significant progress in adopting effective and publicly-acceptable plans for emissions reductions at the lowest costs to the regulated community.

resource.name: Wetlands: Wildly Beneficial
resource.description: Did you know that any place you stand in the State of Delaware is usually within one mile of a wetland? Approximately 25% of the state today is covered by wetlands, but a lot of wetland area has been lost over time due to land conversion to farms and housing developments, storms, and sea level rise.

resource.name: Why Are Horseshoe Crabs Important?
resource.description: Horseshoe crabs are important for many reasons, including their impacts ecologically, medically, and economically.

resource.name: Keep it Clean: Taking Care of Our Coast
resource.description: Delaware is known for having some of the highest-quality beaches in the nation because of our commitment to water cleanliness and shoreline nourishment.

resource.name: Working Together: WATAR
resource.description: The Watershed Approach to Toxics Assessment and Restoration (WATAR) program was formed to increase collaborative efforts between different divisions within DNREC.

resource.name: Get Involved with Horseshoe Crabs
resource.description: Citizen science drives a large undertaking in understanding the horseshoe crab population, drawing people from all over the country to help with the spawning survey.

resource.name: Go Green: Energy Efficiency
resource.description: Reducing energy consumption at home and in the workplace decreases the cost of the electric bill each month, but it also reduces air and water pollution, as well as greenhouse gas emissions.

resource.name: Delaware Beaches: Shifting Shores
resource.description: Delaware's beaches are a major draw in the summertime for people who live in the surrounding areas for vacation and recreational opportunities.

resource.name: Horseshoe Crab Science
resource.description: Every year, state, federal, and non-governmental organizations coordinate efforts to conduct a standardized spawning survey at select Delaware Bay beaches.

resource.name: Marine Debris: Adrift at Sea
resource.description: Every year, billions of pounds of trash end up in the world's oceans, even making their way to areas of the earth that are uninhabited by humans.

resource.name: Go Green: Clean Transportation
resource.description: Rebates provide incentives for Delaware citizens and businesses to buy or lease new alternative fuel vehicles. The program also works in alignment with Delaware's commitment to innovation in the transportation sector, reducing greenhouse gases, and improving Delaware's air quality.

resource.name: A Learning Environment: Student Outreach
resource.description: A major part of DNREC's mission is to provide educational opportunities to students on the historical, cultural, and natural significance of the environment. Creating a better understanding of the natural environment can inspire stewardship as well as protection and preservation of our historical and natural resources.

resource.name: Go Green: Renewable Energy
resource.description: Renewable energy comes from natural sources, such as sunlight, wind, water, and geothermal heat. Delaware supports the use of renewable energy by homeowners and businesses through grant funding, incentives, and technical guidance.

resource.name: Beach Protection and Enhancement
resource.description: Waves and wind move sand around throughout the year. Vegetation can provide stability and capture sand at the base of the plant to allow the surface to incrementally rise, one grain at a time.

resource.name: A Line in the Sand: Beach Preservation
resource.description: DNREC works to protect and enhance eroding beaches to enable continued protective and recreational use through science-based dune and beach management practices, such as: nourishing eroding beaches, planting beach grass to promote dune growth, and fencing dunes to protect them from pedestrian traffic.

resource.name: WATAR: Fishable, Swimmable, Potable
resource.description: The Watershed Approach to Toxics Assessment and Restoration (WATAR) program focuses on achievement of these three goals.

resource.name: Wetlands: Purify, Provide, Protect
resource.description: Aside from providing scenic vistas, serving recreational purposes, and fueling Delaware's ecotourism economy, wetlands have many other important functions. They clean and replenish our drinking waters, provide habitat and food for wildlife, absorb floodwaters, and protect our coasts from storm damage and sea level rise.

resource.name: Marine Debris: Make a Choice
resource.description: Wondering how you can make a difference? There are many ways we can reduce our dependence on plastic and single-use items and help prevent debris from entering the ocean.

resource.name: Wetlands: Watershed Report Cards
resource.description: With 25% of Delaware's land area consisting of wetland habitat and the continual loss of wetlands due to sea level rise and development, it is important to understand how healthy our remaining wetlands are.

resource.name: Wetlands: A Valuable Resource
resource.description: Although wetlands provide important ecosystem services, wetland management programs must compete with many other important issues for attention and funding from local stakeholders and decision-makers. Economic studies are often conducted to relay the value of services and resources provided by natural systems in dollar amounts.

resource.name: WATAR Spotlight Stories
resource.description: The Watershed Approach to Toxics Assessment and Restoration (WATAR) has had many successful projects that can be attributed to the immense collaborative efforts between state, federal, non-governmental organizations

resource.name: WATAR Science
resource.description: The WATAR team utilizes many methods of evaluation to determine what hazards are present and where they may come from.

resource.name: Marine Debris Science
resource.description: Marine debris can be any size from a boat or a dock that washed away in a storm, to a tiny particle that's hard to distinguish from a grain of sand.

resource.name: Regional Air Quality
resource.description: Through planning, monitoring for National Ambient Air Quality Standards (NAAQS), and pollution control methods, DNREC continually works to improve the quality of the environment.

resource.name: Air Quality: Moveable Monitoring Platform
resource.description: DNREC is always looking for better ways to provide citizens with the most accurate and timely air quality data. This moveable monitoring platform can collect data in areas without permanent monitoring stations.

resource.name: Air Quality Science
resource.description: Ozone, carbon monoxide, sulfur dioxide, nitrogen dioxide, particulate matter less than 10 microns, particulate matter less than 2.5 microns, and lead are considered criteria pollutants because of their impact on human health and welfare.

resource.name: A Learning Environment: School Programs
resource.description: Connecting with Delaware's youth is so important for the future of the environment. A great way to get kids excited about learning is to go on field trips. DNREC organizes an extensive number of educational programs geared toward students of all ages and abilities, with many targeting specific grade levels to coordinate with school curricula.

resource.name: A Learning Environment: Events for Students
resource.description: Aside from field trips and classroom visits, DNREC holds and sponsors several events for students throughout the year.

resource.name: A Learning Environment: Teacher Professional Development
resource.description: DNREC provides many opportunities for teachers to become subject matter experts through professional development workshops.

resource.name: Community Connection: Public Education & Outreach
resource.description: Part of DNREC's mission is to inform and educate the public on natural, historical, and cultural resources in Delaware, as well as interact with communities and stakeholders to address environmental policies and regulations.

resource.name: Wetlands Glossary
resource.description: Definitions for terms used within Environmental Perspectives focused on water quality

resource.name: Air Quality Glossary
resource.description: Find definitions of terms used in air quality stories.

resource.name: Community Connection: Participation & Partnerships
resource.description: Part of DNREC's open regulatory development process is to ensure that proposed actions are announced and all interested parties are notified so that people have the opportunity to become involved in the process and have their voices heard.

resource.name: WATAR Quality Glossary
resource.description: Definitions for terms used within Environmental Perspectives focused on remediation of watersheds

resource.name: Community Connection: Volunteer Opportunities
resource.description: DNREC is full of opportunities to get involved in environmental activities throughout the state. The department is always looking for volunteer help to reach more people, take on large monitoring activities, and maintain Delaware's beautiful habitats.

resource.name: Community Connection: Programs & Events
resource.description: DNREC offers many learning opportunities through public programming and events which highlight the importance of various natural, historical, and cultural resources in Delaware.
